answers.answer: I experience the same. I describe it as seeing stars. I'm unsure the cause I'm asking ny Dr tomorrow at by appt.
It is a sign of preclampsia, you need to mention it to your doctor. Maybe try reducing your sodium intake too.

I have been having them since the beginning of my pregnancy and I asked my doctor she said that it's normal.. Now I'll be 38 weeks tomarrow and I still get them. I don't think they're normal but she was no help lol
Oh wow thats strange..have u tried seeing another doctor for a second opinion?
I have a doctor appointment on friday..do u think i will be ok til then??

You should be fine until then! We'll I have an appointment on Friday too I'm going to ask again caus I didn't know it was a sign of pregnancy. My doctor said it was if you didn't eat or drink enough. She said if that happens sit down and drink some water or eat something.
Lol sign of preeclampsia , not sign of pregnancy haha.  I must be tired typing all this.
I have been getting those for years now

I'm pretty sure its the blood cells in your eyes your seeing like looking at the sun you see little clear looking dots floating around...I'd say its from the increase of blood flow. But I'd make sure with your doctor
Sudden change in vision ( including "seeing stars") is a very common sign of preclampsia. I was taken out of work with my first due severe swelling and risk of preclampsia.
Its ok but i will definitly ask wen i go friday...
I havent really eaten anything today accept popeyes nd a pb&j..
Its happened to me to ...idk abt preclampsia my doctor says my pregnancy is completely normal&healthy .

question: Today i started noticing that my eyes were seeing like these little clear things flying around but it wasnt nothing forreal nd  i thought i was seeing things but it happened twice already...wat could it be?
title: what could it be
